courses.subject: RMCE
courses.title: Basic Clinical Embryology
courses.description: The aim of this module is to provide basic knowledge on human embryology from fertilization through birth. It includes:1. The mammalian reproductive system2. Gametogenesis3. Fertilisation and Early embryogenesis4. Embryonic Development of special systems5. Congenital malformations
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MSc Reproductive Medicine and Clinical Embryology

courses.subject: RMCE
courses.title: Advanced Clinical Embryology

meetings.instructor:
Professor CHAN Yiu Leung, 
Professor CHUNG Pui Wah Jacqueline

courses.description: This course allows students to have a highly advanced theoretical and practical understanding of human embryology. It helps student to understand more the applied aspects of clinical embryology. And, it help students to have a comprehensive overview of all aspects of the ART Laboratory, including the set-up and running of the laboratory, specific procedures, and quality control to ensure the highest possible success rates in an IVF program
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MSc Reproductive Medicine and Clinical Embryology
courses.course_syllabus:
Clinical embryology lab procedure flow overview ( Lab common rules, sample ID, handling and clinical embryologist behavior)
Clinical Attachment-1
Lecture part -1: Jan. 14, 2017 afternoon ( 14:00 - 19:00)
Oocyte retrieval and COC/oocyte assessment
Semen preparation for ART
Assisted hatching
Embryo transfer
Our center - clinical side
Our center - lab side
Lecture part -2 : Jan. 15, 2017 morning ( 08:00 - 12:00)
Culture of preimplantation human embryos in vitro - 1: IVF lab (What is an IVF Lab: environment, equipment, culture system)
Insemination- 1: conventional insemination and ICSI
Insemination- 2: preparation and evaluation of oocyte for ICSI
IVF lab data management/ Document management in the ART laborotory: computer network system
Clinical Attachment-2
Human Embryo Culture
Human embryo devolopment in vitro
Embryo culture in vitro (from zygote to blastosyt) - history and introduction
Culture of preimplantation human embryos in vitro - 1: media
Culture of preimplantation human embryos in vitro - 2: culture system
Two Step Media
Single Step Media
Embryo Assessment and Selection
What is embryo assessment and why the embryo selection is needed
Fertilization check
Embryo selection - 1: mophology assessment - pronuclear, early cleavage, cleavage, morula, and blastocyst
Embryo selection - 2: kinetics and dynamics assessment - Time-lapse assessment
Embryo selection - 3: the other invasive and non-invasive assessments (PGS, embryo metabolomics, Omics, Oxygen consumption...)
Cryopreservation
Basic Cryobiology
Oocyte cryopreservation: slow freezing and vitrification
Embryo cryopreservation: slow freezing and vitrification
Ovary tissue cryopreservation
Fertility preservation strategies and managing the cryopreserved human materials
Other technologies and procedures used by IVF lab
Nuclear transfer and cytoplasmic transfer
Mitochondria transfer
Establishing and maintaining an IVF Laboratory
Establishment of an ART laboratory: location, construction, and design (including alarm system / ID system)
What makes an IVF lab successful: KPI and benchmarking, staff, facility, equipment, consumables, processess, procedures, management, and communications
Other technologies and procedures used by IVF lab
Oocyte in vitro maturation
Establishing and maintaining an IVF Laboratory
Quality management and risk management in a ART laboratory: Quality Control and Quality Assurance
Current standards for the ART laboratory: guidelines for good practice in IVF laboratories
Trouble shooting
IVF lab enviroment - air quality, VOCs, temperature, and lighting
IVF culture system - Tep, pH, gas, osmometry, and other factors
Procedures and staff
Preimplantation Genetic Testing
PGD and PGS
Embryo biopsy: Polar body biopsy, Day3 cleavage stage embryo biopsy, and Day5 blastocyst biopsy
Future deveolopment
The future of IVF Lab
Laboratory and its environment: evidence of effects of clean room technology upgrade

courses.subject: RMCE
courses.title: Andrology
courses.description: This course provides a knowledge set appropriate for the broad range of health care professionals involved in the treatment of the infertile male, provide training in the assessement of parameters of male reproductive function, and assist professionals in identifying strategies for the treatment of male infertility. The course includes:1. The physiology and pathophysiology of male reproductive function2. Key elements of the male factor evaluation3. Basic and advanced testing of reproductive function4. Surgical and nonsurgical treatments of male infertility5. Strategies for male fertility preservation

courses.subject: RMCE
courses.title: Clinical Issues and Controversies in ART

meetings.instructor:
Professor CHAN Yiu Leung, 
Professor CHUNG Pui Wah Jacqueline

courses.description: In this course, the latest opinion and controversies in ART field (including both clinical part and lab part) will be reviewed and discussed.It includes the latest opinion and controversies in:1. ART diagnosis2. ART treatment3. ART technology4. The latest guidelines and opinions in the ART world5. The latest regulation and law in the ART world6. The latest opinion regarding ART Ethics Assessment: Debate
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MSc Reproductive Medicine and Clinical Embryology
courses.course_syllabus:
Introduction: Why are there so many controversies issues over ART?
A. Controversial issues
Freezing 2– Controversies issues in oocyte freezing --
Embryo culture 1 – sequential culture medium vs single step culture medium
Embryo culture 2 – low oxygen culture vs atmospheric oxygen culture
Assisted hatching – Does it help?
Should we perform ICSI on non-male factor patient?
Embryo selection 1 – Traditional morphology vs dynamic morphology
Embryo selection 2 - The debates around PGS
Embryo transfer 2 – Double embryo ET or Single embryo ET
Embryo transfer 1 - D3 Et or D5 ET - Does blastocyst culture help all patients?
Freezing 1- Slow freezing vs Vitrification
Embryo transfer 3 - Fresh ET or frozen ET ( is it time for freezing all now?)
Controversies issue in oocyte retrieval - Flush or not flush
Surgical sperm retrieval - MESA or TESA ?
IVM - An experimental procedure or an established routine medical procedure
Optimizing Natural Fertility
Implantation failure -- whose fault- Embryo or Endometrium ?
B. Ethics, legal issues and policy in medically assisted reproduction
Ethics
Ethics issues in ART field
Regulations and laws in ART field: Europe, US and Hong Kong

courses.title: Infertility and IVF Clinical Counseling
courses.description: This course allows students to gain an understanding of the complex issues of infertility, modern fertility treatment, as well as current management strategies for infertile couples. It includes:1. Definition and diagnosis of infertility2. Treatment strategies of infertility3. Patient support and counselling
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MSc Reproductive Medicine and Clinical Embryology
courses.learning_outcomes:
Students are expected to:
a. Acquire basic knowledge on the medical and counselling aspects of reproductive medicine;
b. Develop counselling skills and techniques through hands-on experience; and
c. Build a peer support network.

courses.subject: RMCE
courses.title: Genetics in Reproductive Medicine

meetings.instructor:
Professor CHAN Yiu Leung, 
Professor CHUNG Pui Wah Jacqueline

courses.description: Reproductive genetics is an increasing part of the assisted reproductive technology (ART) practice. Daily, ART centers use genetic information when couples undergo ethnicity screening, when donors are screened and chosen for recipient couples, to determine the cause of infertility or recurrent pregnancy loss, and when utilizing preimplantation genetic screening (PGS) and preimplantation genetic diagnosis (PGD). However, the application of genetic information and genetic testing is often limited due to lack of knowledge by the medical providers in the ART practice. This course serves to provide basic to complex genetic information to help such practices start to fill this education gap and competently apply genetic information to improve patient care. It includes:1. Both basic genetics education and review of real time application. 2. The faculty will address current knowledge of the genetic causes of infertility 3. The latest research on and testing for infertility treatment and diagnosis4. The gamete donor and gestation carrier screening5. The PGD in clinical application6. The latest information about PGS7. The latest technology and its applications
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MSc Reproductive Medicine and Clinical Embryology
courses.course_syllabus:
Introduction: Get to know reproductive genetics
Basic genetics and medical genetics
Human reproduction and Epigenetics
Human reproduction and Reproductive genetics
Technology development in genetic testing
Noninvasive prenatal testing (NIPT)
Single molecule sequencing and its applications
PGD and PGS technologies
Mosaicism in preimplantation human embryos
Mitochondrial DNA and mtDNA copy number and testing
Clinical practices in reproductive genetics and case studies

courses.subject: RMCE
courses.title: Reproductive Medicine & Assisted Reproductive Technology – Overview
courses.description: This course allows students to gain an overall picture of ART, including basic conception, definition, basic clinical procedure, basic lab procedure, as well as the most updated knowledge and technology. It includes:1. The development of ART history2. The components of ART team 3. The basic procedures and responsibility of each ART components4. Communication of each components5. Definition and diagnosis of infertility6. Treatment strategies of infertility7. Patient support and counsellingAssessment: written examination
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MSc Reproductive Medicine and Clinical Embryology
courses.learning_outcomes:
Students are expected to:
1. Understand the ART history and current technology development
2. Acquire the basic conception of Reproductive medicine and ART
3. Acquire basic knowledge on the ART treatment
4. Understand the whole procedure of ART in current clinical practice
courses.course_syllabus:
The development of ART history
The components of ART team
The basic procedures and responsibility of each ART components
Communication of each components
Definition and diagnosis of infertility
Treatment strategies of infertility
Patient support and counselling

courses.subject: RMCE
courses.title: Reproductive Medicine & Assisted Reproductive Technology - Clinical
courses.description: This course allows students to gain detail knowledge and basic information about the modern ART treatment, infertility complex issues, as well as current management strategies for infertile patients.It includes:1. Investigation of infertility 2. Treatment strategies of infertility3. Ovulation induction4. In vitro fertilization in a clinical IVF lab5. Complications of ART (e.g. ovarian hyperstimulation syndrome)6. Counseling of infertile complex issues 7. Patient support

The students are expected to have knowledge and understand:

2. Infertility diagnosis
3. Infertility treatment strategies
4. The principle and strategy of ovulation induction
5. Basic procedure of oocyte retrieval
6. Basic procedure of embryo transfer
7. The strategy in counseling infertile patients
8. How to handle complications of ART treatment in clinical

courses.subject: RMCE
courses.title: Cell Biology and Molecular Biology
courses.description: The aim of this module is to quickly review the reproductive medicine related basic knowledge of cell biology and molecular biology, as well as the most update related knowledge. It includes:1. The cell structure and cell organelles2. The cell physiological properties 3. The cell metabolic processes and signaling pathway4. The cell cycles5. The structure and function of DNA, RNA and protein6. The processes of replication, transcription and translation7. The techniques of molecular biology8. The interactions between cell and their environment Assessment: written examination
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MSc Reproductive Medicine and Clinical Embryology
courses.learning_outcomes:
The students are expected to acquire the basic and updated knowledge on:
1. Cell biology and molecular biology of the Cell
2. Modern techniques of cell biology and molecular biology
courses.course_syllabus:
The cell structure and cell organelles
The cell physiological properties
The cell metabolic processes and signaling pathway
The cell cycles
The structure and function of DNA, RNA and protein
The processes of replication, transcription and translation
The techniques of molecular biology
The interactions between cell and their environment

courses.subject: RMCE
courses.title: Research Methodology
courses.description: This course facilitates students to use statistics to carry out their research projects adequately. It includes: 1. Basic research methodology2. Basic statistical concepts3. Research process and encourages an appreciation of why and how research is generatedAssessment: Written Examination
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MSc Reproductive Medicine and Clinical Embryology
courses.learning_outcomes:
Students are expected to be able to:
1. understand basic concepts of research and its methodologies
2. identify the components of a literature review process
3. identify the types of research methods best suited for investigating different types of problems and questions
4. develop research questions that based on and build upon a critical appraisal of existing research
5. understand basic statistical concepts
6. design a research proposal
7. be aware of the ethical principles of research, ethical challenges and approval process
courses.course_syllabus:
Concepts of research
Making a research questions
Screening test and ROC
Introduction to the tool kit: Computer programs and graphics
Probability
Meta-analysis
Prediction
Bayesian Probability
Receiver Operator Characteristics and Exercise
Assessment: what is it about
Course overview, Questions and Answers, evaluation and feedback
Diagnostic testing
Critical appraisal of scientific publications (clinical)
Important great studies in obstetrics
From data collection to laboratory analysis
Common methodologies used in qualitative research
Interventional study, RCT
Ethical and legal issues related to research
Tips to get successful publication
Translating results to practice
To plan a research, what, why
How to write a research proposal
Quality of life assessment
Common data collection methods in quantitative researches and related principles
Screening and cleaning the data
Survey & Questionnaires, gambling
Risk assessment & prediction
Use of Normogram in obstetrics and gynaecology
Literature search
Sources of funding for research and grant writing
Epidemiological study

courses.subject: RMCE
courses.title: Research Project
courses.description: Research topics related to reproductive medicine and clinical embryology will be provided. The students are required to perform research work related to thesis topic under direction of their assigned supervisors, who are the principal investigators and senior academic staffs from the Chinese University of Hong Kong.The research project will either be a laboratory-based or clinical data-based investigation. Students are required to write up the result in a dissertation.

courses.subject: RMCE
courses.title: Clinical Attachment
courses.description: It will be clinic-based and laboratory-based attachment, students are required to attach to: A. Clinic-based Attachment1. Gynaecological out-patient clinic for infertility and gynae-endocrinological case management.2. Gynaecological operative theater for infertility surgical management.3. Assisted Reproductive Unit for cycle monitoring, ovarian stimulation, oocyte retrieval, embryo transfer, intrauterine insemination.B. Laboratory-based attachmentStudents will perform to followings by using the materials donated for teaching purpose after obtaining patient informed written consent.1. Semen analysis.2. Sperm preparation.3. Gametes handling4. Embryo culture5. Micromanipulation6. Crypreservation of gametes and embryos
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MSc Reproductive Medicine and Clinical Embryology
courses.learning_outcomes: The clinical laboratory attachment will provide an environment for the students to undertake practical laboratory training. After the training, they are expected to understand different practical techniques and processes related to reproductive medicine and at the same time consolidate their working knowledge. It will be beneficial to the students to get the hands-on experience needed for a laboratory-based career and also improve their communication skills required in the workplace.

Professor CHAN Yiu Leung, 
Professor CHUNG Pui Wah Jacqueline

courses.description: In this course, students will review the literature on a selected topic of reproductive medicine / clinical embryology under the supervision of a teaching staff. Students are required to discuss their progress with their supervisors and complete a written report and make a seminar presentation at the end of the course.

courses.learning_outcomes: This course improves students’ ability of writing a critical appraisal to published reproductive medicine and clinical embryology related research paper.

courses.course_syllabus:
It will be clinic-based and laboratory-based attachment, students are required to attach to:
1. Clinic-based Attachment
a. Gynaecological out-patient clinic for infertility and gynae-endocrinological case management.
b. Gynaecological operative theater for infertility surgical management.
c. Assisted Reproductive Unit for cycle monitoring, ovarian stimulation, oocyte retrieval, embryo transfer, intrauterine insemination.
2. Laboratory-based attachment
Students will perform to followings by using the materials donated for teaching purpose after obtaining patient informed written consent.
a. Semen analysis.
b. Sperm preparation.
c. Gametes handling
d. Embryo culture
e. Micromanipulation
f. Cryopreservation of gametes and embryos
